greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First trisection of A061040.
comment: a(n) gives the denominator of (n-1)*(n+1)/(9*n^2), for n >= 1. The numerator is given given by A144454(n). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 16 2018
formula: For n >= 1: a(n) = n^2 if n == 1 (mod 9) or == 8 (mod 9). For other n: a(n) = 3*n^2 if n == 1 (mod 3) or == 2 (mod 3), and a(n) = 9*n^2  if n == 0 (mod 3). From the denominator comment above. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 16 2018
mathematica: Table[Which[MemberQ[{1, 8}, Mod[n, 9]], n^2, Mod[n, 3] != 0, 3 n^2, True, 9 n^2], {n, 41}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 16 2018 *)
xref: Cf. A061040, A017198 (2nd trisection), A017234 (3d trisection).
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Nov 09 2008
ext: Offset changed from 0 to 1, and extended by _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 16 2018
